content: this legal case involves a property dispute that started in may 2021 in the municipal court split the property in question is a plot of land with a building known as r house p g the property was divided into shares and a public auction was held to dissolve the coownership the petitioner who is the legal successor of pm llc filed a proposal to terminate the coownership community and claims ownership of specific parts of the property various documents have been submitted as evidence including land registry extracts court decisions and a survey report a hearing was scheduled for february 2017 during which the petitioners representative proposed an onsite inspection to assess the possibility of a material division of the property the counter parties ps llc t inc and f llc stated that they were proceeding as coowners with a total of 34 shares and believed a geometric division of the property was possible a courtappointed expert conducted an onsite inspection and proposed a possible geometric division of the building the counter party submitted a proposal for the geometric division and the court examined the land registry the courtappointed expert stated that the property should not be divided due to various reasons the counter parties raised objections to the expert opinion and requested a new expert examination a decision was made to terminate the coownership community in march 2019 but it was appealed and accepted in september 2020 leading to a new proceeding the court held a hearing in april 2021 where a court expert appraiser provided instructions based on the appellate decision the counter parties requested a new expert examination but it was rejected the judge urged the parties to reach an agreement but if not a civil division would be conducted according to legal provisions and the agreement of the parties
